page.description: Creates an HTML grid (browse) of records from a specific table.
page.syntax: A5W_GRID( Properties as P [, Show_Raw_Code as L ] )

argument.name: Properties
argument.description: A pointer that controls the display properties of the resulting grid. See Components below

argument.name: Show_Raw_Code
argument.description: A logical flag that when set to true will display the Xbasic/HTML code used to generate the resulting web page. This option can be useful when learning to write Application Server pages and is usually used in the Interactive Window.

section.description: Deprecated. This function is deprecated as of V10. It will not be available in future versions. Populate the Properties dot variable before calling the function.

case.title: .data.source
case.description: Required. The name of the table to retrieve the data from.

case.title: .data.index
case.description: Optional. Sets the primary index for the table.

case.title: .grid.border
case.description: Optional. Default = 0. The size of the grid (HTML table) border.

case.title: .grid.cellspacing
case.description: Optional. Default = 1. The amount of grid (HTML table) cell spacing.

case.title: .grid.cellpadding
case.description: Optional. Default = 2. The amount of grid (HTML table) cell padding.

case.title: .grid.bgcolor
case.description: Optional. Default = #F5F5F5. The background color to be used for the grid (HTML table).

case.title: .grid.header.font_face
case.description: Optional. Default = Arial. The font face to be used for the column headings (field names).

case.title: .grid.header.font_size
case.description: Optional. Default = 4. The font size to be used for the column headings (field names).

case.title: .grid.header.font_color
case.description: Optional. Default = #0000FF. The font size to be used for the column headings (field names).

case.title: .grid.header.bgcolor
case.description: Optional. Default = #D3DCE3. The row background color to be used for the column headings (field names).

case.title: .grid.data.max_rows
case.description: Optional. Default = 10. The maximum number of rows (records) to be displayed.

case.title: .grid.data.font_face
case.description: Optional. Default = Arial. The font face to be used for the data columns (fields).

case.title: .grid.data.font_size
case.description: Optional. Default = 3. The font size to be used for the data columns (fields).

case.title: .grid.data.font_color
case.description: Optional. Default = #000000. The font size to be used for the data columns (fields).

case.title: .grid.data.bgcolor
case.description: Optional. Default = #DDDDDD. The row background color to be used for the data columns (fields).

case.title: .grid.data.alternate_rows
case.description: Optional. Default = .F.. A logical flag to allow alternating rows of data to differ in their display. When false, all data rows are displayed the same. When true, rows of data alternate using the values above and below.

case.title: .grid.data.alt.font_face
case.description: Optional. Default = Arial. The font face to be used for the even data columns (fields) when Properties.grid.data.alternate_rows is set to true.

case.title: .grid.data.alt.font_size
case.description: Optional. Default = 3. The font size to be used for the even data columns (fields) when Properties.grid.data.alternate_rows is set to true.

case.title: .grid.data.alt.font_color
case.description: Optional. Default = #000000. The font color to be used for the even data columns (fields) when Properties.grid.data.alternate_rows is set to true.

case.title: .grid.data.alt.bgcolor
case.description: Optional. Default = #CCCCCC. The row background color to be used for the even data columns (fields) when Properties.grid.data.alternate_rows is set to true.

case.title: .column.1.data_expression
case.description: Optional. If .column is omitted, all of the fields in the table are displayed. If any of .column is defined, .data_expression is required. The expression used to define the data in the first column. This can be as simple as a field name or more complex such as an expression. Currently limited to a field name only.

case.title: .column.1.column_label
case.description: Optional. Default = data_expression. The column label to be displayed.

case.title: .column.1.drilldown
case.description: Optional. Not Defined

case.title: .column.1.drilldown_event
case.description: Optional. Not Defined

case.title: .column.1.hyperlink
case.description: Optional. An expression to define the hyperlink for the data in this column.

page.discussion: The A5W_GRID() function creates an HTML grid (browse) of records from a specific table. This function only works with the Application Server.

section.title: Example
section.description: This code in an A5W page will create an HTML page with a grid showing all of the firstname, lastname, city, and company fields of the first 5 records in the Customer table.
section.example: p.data.source = "customer" p.grid.data.max_rows = 5 p.data.column.1.data_expression = "Firstname" p.data.column.2.data_expression = "Lastname" p.data.column.3.data_expression = "City" p.data.column.4.data_expression = "Company"

section.description: This code run in the Interactive Window will show the combination of Xbasic and HTML required to create the output of the A5W page in the previous example.
